page.title: 04EAST STOKE VILLAGE
page.content: {East Stoke}is situated at a crossroads on the{Fosse Way,}4 miles SW of {Newark.}It is a small village of 135 inhabitants which has dwindled from the 450 who were resident there 200 years ago. This depopulation is mainly due to the now highly mechanised arable farming with the consequent loss of employment. Half the working population still work on the farms, some are self-employed and the rest work in{Newark}or{Nottingham.} There are four tied cottages for farm workers, 2 pensioners' bungalows, and seven council houses. Some new houses are now being built, the first development for many years.
